correspondence.translation[0].definition: the letters that someone sends and receives, especially official or business letters
A secretary came in twice a week to deal with his correspondence.
the process of sending and receiving letters
The magazine is unable to enter into any correspondence on medical matters.
All correspondence between us must cease.
He had been in correspondence with her for several years before they finally met.
a relationship or connection between two or more ideas or facts
There was no correspondence between the historical facts and Johnsonâ€™s account of them.
correspondence.translation[1].definition: letters exchanged between people, especially business or official letters
Any correspondence concerning the inquiry should be sent to Mr Alan Wood.
the process of sending and receiving letters
Details eventually were given after correspondence with the Western Board.
